content.description: Down climb to the left of the Zebra Slab Boulder.
Slab to the left of the tree down climb use side pulls and crimps to climb the slabby face with black and white stripes.
Left side of the Wave Wall is the easy down climb and an easy boulder problem for those looking to scuff up those new shoes!
content.location: Left side of the main Wave Wall overhang. Just to the left of the down climb tree you will find easy holds to stand on and manage your way up a slab.

climbs.name: Touch my camera through the fence

content.description: Start with the mono pinch pockets under the roof. Get your feet on and throw up to the crimps on the face. Reset your feet and go left to the side pull. Bring your right hand up to the diagonal undercling pocket reset your feet and throw high to the crack system. Top out is next to the tree at the top of bluff very dirty at top use tree to the left for down climb. Don't use the tree to the left or the pockets on the face to the right.

Start on the diagonal shelf with a left foot heel hook and pull your way through the pocketed face get your feet up and throw high with the left hand. From here just reset your feet and top out to the right of the tree in the middle of the bluff.

From a sit start beneath the roof, reach out then pull through the roof. Then up on fun pockets and ledges until you can make the exciting reach to a good jug just over the lip. From there, smear and throw for the amazing jug a bit farther back. Top out and walk off to the right. A bit committing up high but it's easy to stick a leg behind you and escape via Easy Ramp.
content.location: The rightmost line of the Wave Roof wall.

content.description:
On the left side of the Wave Roof, just right of the big tree, start from a sit start and reach out to holds along the lip. Pull the lip to continue up the slab to the top of the exposed rock. I recommend down climbing by stepping left to easier rock, avoiding any dirt and plants above. 

 Great landing area but can hold a bit of moisture during the wet season. Take a tarp folded inside your bouldering pad. See photos
content.location: On the left side of the Wave Roof, just right of the big tree, start from a sit start, under the roof, and reach out to holds along the lip. Finish at  the top of the slab and down climb by moving left to easier down climbing near the tree.

content.description: This is the standing start option for one of the center roof lines. Reach high and grab a good left hand and reach far right to get a lower right hand. Use a high right foot, at the lip of the roof to then bump your right hand up to a high right hold. After reaching the top of the slab, avoid the dirt walk around by traversing left on good feet to reach the down climb tree slab.
content.location: Center of the Wave Wall roof

content.description: Start on big pocket cluster on face to the left of Sencha Boost. Make your way up and left to big full hand pocket and top out.

Sit start to the left of V1 down climb start in large pocket and reach high for deep flake. Reposition your feet and throw high to ledge next to small tree then use the super positive basketball size pocket to top out but very dirty on top.

The obvious corner ramp on the right side of the Wave Roof, just after the roof ends. Useful for scoping out the higher holds on Sencha Boost. Downclimb until the shrubs up top (possibly poison ivy?) are cleared or you can traverse left at a harder grade (V0) at the top on awesome holds to join the top of Sencha Boost.
content.location: Just to the right of Sencha Boost and the Wave Wall cave.

content.description: Start with hands on the lip of the roof and use a right heel hook to gain higher hands. Transition from right heel to right toe smear to bump your right hand to high hold. Difficulty is now over. Stand up and finish the short slab and traverse left to the tree slab down climb.
content.location: Center of the Wave Wall roof

content.description: The crux is either the mono or the dynamic move. The top is still pretty dirty.
content.location: Right of Crisscross. Start with your left finger in the hole and right hand on the single-hand jug.

content.description:
Wave Wall: Almost directly west of the Beach, along the Robinson exposure, is a roof section of pockets that wave rolls out over sandy soil and a good landing zone.

Bouldering Problems are roughly 15 ft tall and provide a diversity from easy to difficult (range from V easy to V5).

Ratings: While easier climbs are given a rating number representing the problem to be no harder than the rating represented, lines rated V0 (5.10) and up are given a specific max crux rating. This should help you plan your visit and navigate your way along the bluff while using Mountain Project. See the scale below to help understand route difficult conversion.

Please provide feedback using your MP App. Star rating and rate difficulty feedback helps the next visitors use the app.

Rating Scale:

V Scale        YDS       GYM

                    = 5.3 Descent      = 5.4         VB5             = 5.5       5.7 (VB) VB6             = 5.6       VB7             = 5.7       5.9 (V0) VB8             = 5.8       VB9             = 5.9        5.10 (V1) V0-              = 5.9+       V0               = 5.10       V0+             = 5.10+   5.10 (V3)                             V1               = 5.11a V2               = 5.11b V3               = 5.11c    5.11 (V4) V4               = 5.11d V5               = 5.12a     V6               = 5.12b   5.12 (V5) V7               = 5.12c V8               = 5.12d V9               = 5.13a V10             = 5.13b   V11             = 5.13c V12             = 5.13d V13             = 5.14a V14             = 5.14b V15             = 5.14c V16             = 5.14d V17             = 5.15a V18             = 5.15b V19             = 5.15c V20             = 5.15d V21             = 5.16a
